dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Description
dataObjects.title: General Description
dataObjects.description:
From Boulenger (1899):

Depth of body 1 5/6 to 2 times in total length, length of head 3 to 3 3/4 times. Head twice as long as broad, upper profile feebly concave; snout short, not twice as broad as long, a little longer than eye in adult, projecting slightly beyond mouth; eye 3½ (young) to 5 times in length of head; a narrow adipose lid in front of and behind eye; interorbital width 2/5 to 1/2 length of head. Gill-rakers extremely short, 30-40 on lower part of anterior arch. Dorsal 18-21 (4-5 unbranched), originating above last ray of ventral, falciform, anterior rays produced, at least as long as head. Adipose fin not or but little longer than deep, its base 1/3 to 1/2 its distance from dorsal. Anal 25-30 (3 unbranched), pointed, anterior rays produced. Pectoral 3/4 to 5/6 length of head, reaching ventral. Caudal deeply forked. Caudal peduncle a little longer than deep. Scales 60-66, 15-16/16-18, 13-14 between lateral line and root of ventral. Silvery, bluish grey on the back.

Total length 390 mm.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Africa:  Congo basin, from the lower Congo (Ref. 42510) up to Lake Upemba (Ref. 2970) (Luapula-Moer and southern Kasaï excluded; Ref. 2970) in Democratic Republic of the Congo and Republic of Congo. Also in the Rufiji-Ruaha in Tanzania (Ref. 4967, 7095).
dataObjects.references: Daget, J. 1984 Citharinidae. p. 212-216. In J. Daget, J.-P. Gosse and D.F.E. Thys van den Audenaerde (eds.) Check-list of the freshwater fishes of Africa (CLOFFA). ORSTOM, Paris and MRAC, Tervuren. Vol. 1. (Ref. 7095)

dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Hanssens, M., Moelants, T. & Snoeks, J. 2010. Citharinus congicus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Hanssens, M., Moelants, T. & Snoeks, J.

Reviewer/s
Snoeks, J., Tweddle, D., Getahun, A., Lalèyè, P., Paugy, D., Zaiss, R., Fishar, M.R.A & Brooks, E.

Contributor/s

Justification
This species has a wide distribution throughout the Congo, with no known major widespread threats. It is therefore listed as Least Concern. It has also been assessed regionally as Least Concern for Central Africa. The taxonomic status of the Tanzania population is uncertain and therefore it has been categorized as Data Deficient for East Africa.

History
  • 2009
    Least Concern
  • 2007
    Least Concern
    (IUCN 2009.2)
